identificationModule.briefTitle: High-definition Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation for Facilitating Hand Function Recovery After Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Using Neuroimage and Computational Modeling to Customize High-definition Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation Protocols for Facilitating Hand Function Recovery After Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) had recently been shown having feasibility in modulating cortical excitability transiently during motor training in a noninvasive way. The findings support that tDCS and motor practice can positively promote post-stroke motor learning to improve upper-limb motor recovery after stroke. A randomized controlled trial will be conducted with three groups: HD-tDCS, conventional tDCS and sham HD-tDCS. A 10-session training will be provided to evaluate the effectiveness of transient modulation of cortical excitability through tDCS with clinical assessment scores.

armGroups.label: HD-tDCS group
armGroups.description: Constant current (1mA) will be applied for 20min and the anode will be placed over the defined target area

armGroups.label: Conventional tDCS group
armGroups.description: Constant current (1mA) will be applied for 20min and the anode will be placed over the standard C3/C4 position

armGroups.label: Sham HD-tDCS group
armGroups.description: The stimulator will be shut down after 30s of stimulation. The patients will feel the initial itching sensation at the beginning in order to evaluate the placebo effect.

interventions.name: HD-tDCS group
interventions.description: 5 sintered Ag/AgCl ring electrodes will be used at a radius of \~5cm. The electrodes will be placed inside plastic electrode holders which will be filled with gel to have better contact with the scalp.

interventions.name: Conventional tDCS group
interventions.description: A pair of 25 cm2 rubber electrodes enclosed in saline-soaked sponges and affixed to the head with rubber bands.

interventions.name: Sham HD-tDCS group
interventions.description: A pair of 25 cm2 rubber electrodes enclosed in saline-soaked sponges and affixed to the head with rubber bands.

primaryOutcomes.description: The ARAT has total 19 items, divided into 4 categories (grasp, grip, pinch, and gross arm movement). It ranges from 3 to 0 (best to worse).

secondaryOutcomes.description: The maximum score is 66, divided into 33 items in the form of a 3-point scale (0-2), 0 is cannot perform and 2 performs fully.
The WMFT measures upper limb ability through timed and functional tasks. It has 17 items, ranging from 0 to 5 (worse to best).
